title: Dualie Squelchers
paragraphs: The Dualie Squelchers are a main weapon in Splatoon 2 and Splatoon 3. They are a re-imagining of the Dual Squelcher from Splatoon; if the player performs a dodge roll, their character will connect their Dualie Squelchers, effectively converting them into the Dual Squelcher. The weapon's accuracy is improved in this post-roll state.

Compared to the Splat Dualies, the Dualie Squelchers have a slightly faster roll and are not locked into place, but suffer from an overall reduced firing rate and no fire rate increase after rolling. They have the second most range of any dualie-type weapon in the game since the release of the Douser Dualies. Shots do enough damage to splat opponents with four hits.

The Dualie Squelchers are nearly identical in appearance to the Dual Squelcher's top and bottom parts. However, the tube that connects the two halves of the Dual Squelcher is exclusive to the right Dualie Squelcher.
The Dualie Squelchers come with Point Sensor and Tenta Missiles. They were released on 29 July 2017 at 02:00 UTC.[1]
It appears in three Octo Expansion stations:
- F01E12 Drop the Bass Station
- G06A01 Gnarly Rails Station
- J05C14 Stick 'n' Move Station
- Weapon class: shooter → dualies.
- ▲ Dualie Squelchers have the ability to dodge roll.
- ▲ Player movement speed while firing: 0.6 units/frame → 0.72 units/frame.
- ▲ Maximum shot spread while jumping: 12 degrees → 8 degrees.
- ▲ Initial shot velocity: 22 units/frame  → 23 units/frame.
- ▲ Time until shots reach the minimum damage: 19 frames → 25 frames.
- ▲ Time that shots retain full damage: 6 frames → 9 frames.
- ▼ Time for reticle to finish shrinking after jumping: 60 frames → 70 frames.
- ▼ Maximum chance to shoot towards the outer reticle while on the ground: 25% → 30%.
- ▼ Time that shots travel at the initial velocity: 6 frames → 5 frames.
- ▼ Damage range: 172 units → 155 units.
- ▼ Effective range: 132 units → 115 units.
- ▼ Total range: 177.396 units → 160.396 units.
- ▼ Paint splash radius: 13 units → 11 units.
- Promotional image
- Roll with the Dualie Squelchers, making it look like the Dual Squelcher from Splatoon.
- Official art of Dualie Squelchers, showing the Custom brand in the background.
- An Inkling girl making an "X" sign with her Dualie Squelchers.
- Used by the Inkling on the left.
- Inkling boy with Dualie Squelchers.
- Render
The Dualie Squelchers return in Splatoon 3 with Splat Bombs and Wave Breaker, which is based on the kit that the Dual Squelcher had in Splatoon.
They appear in one mission in Return of the Mammalians:
- 0202 Absorbency and You
- An Inkling with Dualie Squelchers next to a Wave Breaker.
- 2D icon
- The Tableturf Battle card icon of the Dualie Squelchers.
For competitive tips about the Dualie Squelchers

- The way the player holds the Dualie Squelchers after performing a dodge roll makes them appear nearly identical to the Dual Squelcher. Only the upper barrel fires after rolling, similarly to the Dual Squelcher.
Consequently, the Dualie Squelchers are the only weapons of the dualie class with an asymmetrical design.
- The appearance of the weapon is highly reminiscent of power drills.
- The Dualie Squelchers are unique in the fact that the player can move immediately after a dodge roll and jump after performing the first dodge roll.
- When exiting the dodge-roll stance, the Dualie Squelchers make a click sound when they separate.
- In Splatoon 3, Sheldon notes the Dualie Squelchers' ability to "stick and move" in its description, likely referencing Stick 'n' Move Station, which features the weapon.
